questions.explanation: Columns 00 and 10 are adjacent in Gray code order (they differ by one bit in B). The K-map wraps around, making these cells neighbors.

questions.explanation: All four cells have C=1. A varies, B varies, so both are eliminated. The term is simply C.
questions.prompt: Grouping m1, m3, m5, m7 (all cells with C=1) in a 3-variable K-map gives:

questions.explanation: K-map: m1 and m3 form column B=1 → B. m2 and m3 form row A=1 → A. Overlap at m3 is OK. F = A + B.
All minterms have C=0. They form a wrap-around group covering columns 00 and 10 (both rows). Term: C̄.
A group of 4 in a 3-variable map eliminates 2 variables (log₂(4) = 2). Remaining: 3 - 2 = 1 variable.
questions.prompt: A full row in a 3-variable K-map (4 cells) produces a term with how many variables?
